Easy Product Photography Solutions For Small Business

Since you are considering starting your own small business, we can guess that you are a cheerful aspirant filled with passion and new ideas. While that is true, it is also true that you have dreams that dont fit into your small budget. You have considered how to source the best materials, how to create your perfect product, and even found a niche of audience who you are sure will love your creative ideas. But how do you shoot the prefect product photos that highlight how awesome your product is in real life? As a small business owner, you know how important product photography is to attract customers and increasing your conversion rate.

Product photos help you express your business to your potential clients. They work as one of the core mediums of communication and are necessary to build a good first impression. We empathize with the budget struggles you may face regarding this and are here to provide you with easy product photography solutions for your small business that will both minimize costs and get you high quality product photos at the same time.



To build a successful business, you must start small and dream big

Aliko Dungote
Nigerian business magnate

You know what this means right? It means you cant lower your standards for anything. You have to dream big and ensure premium quality in everything you do- whether its your website design, quality of your product or the images you shoot.

Product Photography Tips for Small Business Website

Get product photography idea from big brands and experts

Its always a good idea to do a thorough research first and then jump into action. The same applies for product photography. Being new to this e-commerce business, its more likely that youre not an expert in product photography. This is why you need to focus on educating yourself first. List down the big companies in your industry and visit their website. Now try to comprehend the techniques they are applying in photographing their product; the number and types of photos they are posting, the angles being used etc. For example- you may notice websites posting a main photo consisting of only the product and other shots where details of the product are properly highlighted. You can see videos on YouTube as well and read different blogs as well to get an initial understanding of product photography as well.

Work with a Home Studio or Natural Setup for small business product photography

For a small business, affording a full formal photo studio along with the expensive tools in it may seem scary. And keeping the amount of sales youre likely to make or the range of collections a small business may own, it doesnt seem worth it as well. You do not need a fully designed photo studio to photograph your products. Rather, you can easily setup a home studio and photograph your products there. Pick a comfortable corner of your house with good lighting and decorate it with a table, tripod, camera and a white cloth for the background. Thats it, youre good to go!


Other than that, you can focus on lifestyle photography where you take photos with a relevant background and natural lighting. Also, pairing up your products and shooting them together can aid your business by reducing the need for props and result in duel sales. Try to pick a relevant setup, for example- photographing wines near a vineyard or grape garden, cars on the road, men and womens formal wear near a tall corporate building etc. This is likely to help the viewer better imagine the products use in their lives.

Rely on easier to find tools

Photo shoot require tools and equipment that you cant escape from. Rather than focusing on getting professional and expensive tools, its better to initially start with highly available and DIY solutions. There are certain tools you can make at home. Instead of a backdrop, you can simply use a white wall or paper or simply the floor of your studio (for flat lay photography). You can easily make a DIY softbox that will deflect light perfectly and redirect it equally in all corners of the room. Also, if youre looking for props to use for in the photo shoots, try to think with your creative eye and focus on getting tools that are easily available to you. For example- if youve a face wash with vitamin C in it, pairing it up with sliced up oranges/lemon and plants you have at home may do the trick.



Focus more on Social Media Marketing

As we discussed earlier, during winter, people get more time to be on their phones as the cold forces them to stay at home. As a result, an increase in online shopping has been observed as well. This is the reason you should focus more on social media marketing. Start by making a calendar and properly planning your posts. Its important to maintain consistency and relevancy in the content you post. This is why your content should be in line with the product and industry you operate in. Use social media to highlight the products on your website. Also, update viewers of the offers, deals, and discounts youre offering on your website. Run polls asking them what kinds of collections they want to see next and take their opinions on different matters. Make sure you post high quality product images of the products youre selling right now or hope to sell in the future. High quality images will help your customers know how attractive your product really is, whereas poor quality images will drag down the reputation of your business.

Make shopping an experience, not a chore

Winter is the time to shower your close ones with gifts and surprises. Make your customers feel like a part of your family by providing them with small gifts that catches them by surprise. The gifts dont have to be expensive as well; rather its the surprise element that will get you on their good books. Also, arrange giveaways by inviting them to help expand this family of yours. As they refer your website to their dear ones or invite them to your social Medias, it will help your help you enter new horizons.


Lets make winter easier!

While winter showers a lot of people with feelings of joy, many suffer from misery due to their poor financial conditions. By engaging in Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR), you can use your business to make winter easier. For example, you can launch campaigns where a specific percentage of every sale goes to help people in need. Setting reasonable prices can help people greatly too, as it enables them to buy more products. Doing these things will likely generate a positive image for your business and may even end up boosting your sales. But be careful as you arrange such campaigns. Whatever you do should be from the heart, and the intent to do something good has to be present as well.

Winter is the season of joy- for both consumers and sellers. Its full of festivals, excitement and happiness. Its the time for your e-commerce store to shine and rise up conversion rate. All this is achievable by simply following the right marketing strategies and giving your full focus and effort.
